intro: Strobilanthes timorensis subsp. timorensis, commonly known as the Timor flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. It features lance-shaped leaves and produces striking orange to red bracts that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
